title: Gabriel Martinelli hits two on his first Arsenal start as Nottingham Forest thrashed in Carabao Cup third round
text:
Arsenal were too good for a Forest side that hadn't lost since the first day of the season - CameraSport

Arsenal 5 Nottingham forest 0

An invigorating combination of fresh faces and returning favourites guided Arsenal to a straightforward League Cup victory over Nottingham Forest, with Rob Holding scoring on his comeback from knee injury and teenage forward Gabriel Martinelli striking his first two goals for the club.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

Martinelli, who was signed from Brazil this summer, scored either side of half-time on his first competitive start for Arsenal. There were also goals from Reiss Nelson and Joe Willock, two academy graduates, as Unai Emery’s side produced a complete performance against a strong Nottingham Forest team who had not lost since the opening day of the season.

There were also standout performances for Arsenal from Kieran Tierney, making a terrific debut after joining from Celtic, and from Calum Chambers, who created two goals from full-back positions.

The mood was lifted yet further by the return to action of Hector Bellerin, another long-term absentee. Bellerin created Willock’s goal within minutes of entering the pitch as a second-half substitute.

“It was the perfect opportunity for different players to take minutes and confidence,” Emery said. “The game was very consistent for 90 minutes. Holding, Tierney and Bellerin all back from injuries with a good result and a good game. A clean sheet, lots of positive things. We can be positive.”

Martinelli struck the first after a sustained spell of pressure. He was picked out by a sensational cross from Chambers, who struck the ball as a mid-air volley, allowing the 18-year-old to steer a powerful header into the top corner.

Story continues

“He is a very young player,” ­Emery said of the Brazilian. “He came here and we were waiting and watching how he could improve with us. He is hungry to have that opportunity to help us and his work tonight was perfect.”

The second was scored by Holding, from Nelson’s corner, just moments after the centre-back had taken the captain’s armband from the substituted Mesut Ozil.

The arrival of Bellerin led to the third, with the Spaniard immediately teeing up Willock for a tap-in.

Nelson’s goal followed another rampaging run by the excellent Chambers, now operating at left-back, before Martinelli secured a fifth with a long-range effort which was deflected into the top corner.

Match details

Arsenal (4-2-3-1): Martinez 6; Chambers 8, Mustafi 6, Holding 7, Tierney 8 (Bellerin 77); Torreira 6, Willock 7; Smith Rowe 6 (Saka 44), Ozil 7 (Ceballos 71), Nelson 7; Martinelli 7

Substitutes not used: Macey, Balogun, Bola, Burton

Booked: Nelson





Nottingham Forest (4-5-1): Muric 5; Cash 4, Figueiredo 4, Rodriguez 4, Robinson 5; Lolley 5 (Gabriel 81), Johnson 5, Silva 4, Carvalho 5 (Ameobi 59), Ribeiro 4 (Mighten 78); Adomah 5

Substitutes not used: Smith, Milosevic, Grabban, Sow



Referee: Darren England

Attendance: 53,160
description: An invigorating combination of fresh faces and returning favourites guided Arsenal to a straightforward League Cup victory over Nottingham Forest, with Rob Holding scoring on his comeback from knee injury and teenage forward Gabriel Martinelli striking his first two goals for the club.
